description: Meta paid Trump $25 million to settle a lawsuit he brought over his account suspension after he inspired the January 6 insurrection, with most of the funds going to his presidential library
notes: Settlement highlights complex media capture dynamics and corporate political appeasement

sources.title: Meta agrees to pay $25 million to settle Trump's lawsuit over Facebook, Instagram suspensions
Meta agrees to pay $25 million in Trump lawsuit settlement over suspended accounts
Meta agrees $25m payout to Trump over suspended accounts

summary: Meta settled a lawsuit brought by Donald Trump for $25 million over his social media account suspensions following the January 6 Capitol attack. Most of the settlement, approximately $22 million, will go to Trump's presidential library. Critics like Senator Elizabeth Warren view the settlement as a form of corporate appeasement.
title: Meta agrees to pay $25 million to settle Trump lawsuit over suspended accounts
